dialogues.text: starkly quiet in contrast to the stadium outside. Each pl has retreated into his own world of concentration. Dorn approaches Taylor, who's fitting heavy athletic brac on both knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where Vaughn is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Haven't seen him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me know if you do. I wanna have  a little talk with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorn moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my chicken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's comin' in now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a Bat Boy enter with a bucket of fried chicken. Ce looks at it in bewilderment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One whole chicken, like you said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it no alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, Jo-Buu will like this.  He's gotta be gettin' tired of raw  chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cerrano hefts the bucket somewhat skeptically and take it to his altar, we...

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: warming up in the bullpen. The tension of starting such a important game shows in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, everybody, Harry Doyle bidding  you a Wahoo welcome from beautiful  Municipal Stadium, where tonight  before a capacity crowd of 75,000  screaming featherheads, the braves  of the Cuyahoga will leave their  teepees in search of Cleveland's  first League Championship in over 30  years. Standing in the way, their  long time nemesis, the New York  Yankees, the Big Boys of Broadway,  who have beaten the Indians like a  tom-tom all year long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down in the dugout, the players are lined up ready to tak the field. They exchange words of encouragement, hand sla clenched fists, but all at a very low key level. This is  tension time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, guys, let's take it to  'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Indians charge onto the field to a standing ovation. In the center field bleachers Thelma's victory blanket  containing the scores of every Indian game for the season hangs from a railing. Bobby, Vic and Johnny pound the tom toms leading the stadium in a monster version of "In the  Land of Burning Waters." Even the groundskeepers join in. Two down in the first. Harris looking sharp so far... Bou ball to third. Dorn up with it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: Throwing the first pitch. The YANKEE HITTER grounds one t Dorn who throws him out.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCOREBOARD
dialogues.text: 0-0 in the 3rd.

dialogues.speaker: CERRANO
dialogues.text: striking out on a curve ball.

dialogues.speaker: HAYES
dialogues.text: robbing a Yankee of a home run by making a leaping catch  over the fence.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: picking a Yankee runner off first.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCOREBOARD
dialogues.text: 0-0 in the 5th.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: CERRANO
dialogues.text: striking out on a curve ball, trying to check his swing.  Umpire emphatically punches him out.

dialogues.speaker: DOYLE
dialogues.text: Looking past him to the field. Harris is on the mound. Th a runner on second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still nothing -- nothing, top of the  seventh, two down. Harris has been  in trouble all night, but has battled  his way out with the help of some  great defensive plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris comes set and delivers. The Yankee hitter, BURTON, (L) swings and gets all of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh, this one's tagged. Deep center  field. Way back. Way back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hayes climbs up on the wall, but it's long gone. Home run

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's off the reservation, home run.  And the Yankees lead it 2-0.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donovan is a little confused by this. Burton trots around the bases and is greeted by jubilant  teammates at the plate. A silent pall falls on the stadiu As the "2" goes up on the scoreboard, we...

dialogues.speaker: HAYES
dialogues.text: popping up and flinging his bat away in frustration. We t CUTS of the worried fans, chewing fingernails, wadding up programs, hanging their heads, etc.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: grounding out, obviously having trouble running. We take  CUTS of worried faces on the bench.

dialogues.speaker: DORN
dialogues.text: stepping into the batter's box. The crowd is practically  sitting on its hands now. Hope draining away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorn up now, two down, bottom of the  seventh. The Indians running out of  chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorn swings at the first pitch and lines a sharp single t left. The crowd and the Indian bench suddenly come alive. Cerrano moves to the plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll bring on Cerrano, hitless  tonight. As a matter of fact, he  hasn't touched the ball yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd and bleacher band begins to clap as Dorn takes lead. Cerrano swings at the first pitch and misses. An au groan goes through the crowd. The Yankee pitcher gets set again, and throws Cerrano a b roundhouse curve. He misses it a foot. Strike two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, havin' trouble with the curve  ball again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should've gotten him a live  chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cerrano steps out and begins to talk to his bat, gesturin and pointing as if arguing with his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pissed off now, Jo-Buu. I good to  you, I stand up for you. If you no  help me now, I say fuck you, Jo-Buu.  I do it myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cerrano gets back in the box and digs in. The Yankee pitc comes to his stretch and delivers. Another big breaking c ball. Cerrano swings and knocks the crap out of it. Every in the stands and on the bench jumps to their feet, rooti for the ball to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long drive, deep centerfield. Way  back. It might be. It could be. The  ball is... Downtown, welcome to the  Happy Hunting Ground. The game is  tied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fans go crazy as Cerrano circles the bases.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL'S BOX
dialogues.text: Rachel jumps out of her seat, hands above her head. Donov hesitates a beat, then follows suit. Cerrano carries his bat with him, holding it high above h head. As Cerrano disappears into the dugout, we go to the scoreboard as the 2 goes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two down in the top of the ninth,  still tied at 2, Harris working on  an eight-hitter.

dialogues.speaker: YANKEE HITTER
dialogues.text: lining a single to right field. Harris mops his brow,  obviously tiring.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER YANKEE HITTER
dialogues.text: smashing a double off the wall, the lead runner stopping third. Brown signals to the bullpen to get somebody warm.

dialogues.speaker: HARRIS
dialogues.text: on the mound, looking like he's out of gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Activity continues in the pen, as  Harris is really digging himself a  hole now. He got the first two  hitters, and then gave up a single  and a double and has now gone 3-0 to  Cheevers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harris comes set and fires to the plate. It's way high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High, ball four and they're loaded  for Haywood, the biggest Indian killer  of them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brown has seen enough. He makes his way to the mound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the ball from  Harris) You pitched a hell of a game, Steve.  Take a seat and we'll see if we can  get this guy for ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brown signals to the bullpen with his left hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me Vaughn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) You want Vaughn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he hasn't done real well  against this guy, but I got a hunch  he's due.

dialogues.speaker: VAUGHAN
dialogues.text: striding in from the bullpen. He doesn't look relaxed. As nears the infield he purposely doesn't look at Dorn. Dorn stares at him with undisguised venom. As Vaughan gets to the mound, he sees Patton getting his  convict uniform on in the Yankee dugout. He looks away to see Haywood in the on-deck circle smiling out at him. Meanwhile, the CROWD has gone nuts at the sight of Vaughn Bobby, Vic and Johnny are blasting out "Wild Thing" on th tom-toms and the whole stadium, 75,000 strong, is singing it. Doyle just pushes the mic forward and lets the crowd it's work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Ricky, Haywood likes the hard  stuff in. Curve him on the hands,  bust him away, and don't get up with  anything. You listenin' to me Rick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn nods, but we can tell he's too nervous to have dig any of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Patting him on the  butt) O.K., kid, you're my man. Let's go  get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Ricky, this guy is the out you  been waitin' your whole life for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brown and Taylor leave Vaughn alone on the mound, the SIN of the crowd ringing in his ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.K. Vaughn has finished his warmup  and we're ready to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sooner has Taylor settled in behind the plate, than Do starts toward the mound. Vaughn watches him come with fea and trepidation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing it) Oh, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dorn arrives at the mound, and holds out his hand for the ball. Vaughn gives it to him. Dorn rubs it up, staring lo and hard into Vaughn's eyes. Vaughn is sweating bullets.  Finally Dorn speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's cut through the crap. I only  got one thing to say to you. Just  rear back and strike this motherfucker  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles and hands Vaughn the ball back. Vaughn returns smile and accepts the ball. While Dorn trots back to his  position, Vaughn turns his back to the plate for one last moment of concentration. As he turns around to face us, w see a new man as the wicked opening CHORDS of X's "Wild T are heard on the TRACK, only louder and more savage than  before. Vaughn steps up on the rubber, his face hardened into fie resolve. There's nothing nervous about him now. This kid gonna make somebody pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haywood steps in, the American League  triple crown winner. .341 average,  48 homers, 121 R.B.I.'s. He's homered  the only two times he's faced Vaughn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor sets down a sign. Two fingers for the curve ball.  Vaughn shakes it off. Taylor puts down another sign. Vaug shakes it off. Finally, Taylor puts down one finger -- th fast ball. Vaughn nods with steely purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Ricky, let's get nasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn winds and delivers a hissing blur toward the plate Haywood takes a ferocious swing and misses. Strike one. We see the number 97 come up on the digital readout of th SPEED GUN which a club employee holds behind the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Haywood) All right, looks like the boy is  pumped. Sucker was movin', wasn't  it? Ever hit ya, it'd leave a two  foot hole comin' out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor gets ready to flash another sign. The convict jump up and down trying to distract Vaughn. No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (for Haywood's ears) Let's see, what should we call now.  Let's see how he feels about old  number one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor puts down one finger. Vaughn nods and then winds a fires again, another blazing rocket. Haywood takes a wick rip, but doesn't get it. Strike two. 99 comes up on the g The convict has stopped jumpin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice swing, Haywood. Good follow- through. Keep it up, I'll show you  the ball sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fans are going wild. They're all standing now, yellin for a strikeout. Vaughn gets back up on the rubber with t look of an animal sighting prey. Taylor gets down to give the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the curveball. Go with the  heater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, shit, all these pitches to  choose from. Maybe we'll try somethin'  different this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor wiggles his fingers around and then puts down the No. 1. Vaughn gives him a quick nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I don't see you again, Haywood,  have a nice winter. Okay, buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaughn goes into his windup and unleashes a screaming bul toward the plate. Haywood pulls the trigger, but it's alr by him. Strike three. 101 on the gun. Taylor leaps up and gives Vaughn the fist. The fans are going berserk. MUSIC  ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Lordy, three straight heaters  and the Yankees are blown down. No  runs, two hits, three left on, and,  are you ready, Cleveland? We go to  the bottom of the ninth, still tied  at two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doyle turns the mike off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his color man) Can you believe this, Monty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monty takes a big swig straight from the bourbon bottle.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER INDIAN HITTER
dialogues.text: grounding out to short.

dialogues.speaker: HAYES
dialogues.text: walking up to the plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two down in the ninth, Hayes steps  in hitting .291, trying to get  something going for the Tribe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor and the others yell encouragement to Hayes as he d in at the plate. The Yankee pitcher delivers and Hayes hi a high bouncer toward short. The shortstop waits for it t come down and then fires to first. Too late. Hayes streak across the bag, beating the throw by a hair. Once again t CROWD comes to life. The Yankee Manager comes to the mound and waves for a new pitcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Horton is wasting no time. He's  goin' to the Duke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the pen comes BILLY DUKE, a good facsimile of Goos Gossage only Duke is bigger and meaner. (INSERT STORYBOARD #219M)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke leads the league in saves,  strikeouts per inning and nose hairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duke finishes his warmups and stares over at Hayes. H smiles, snaps his black gloves out of his hip pocket, and carefully pulls them on over his hands. The Duke does not care for this kind of showmanship. Brown comes over to talk to Taylor, who's been watching D from the on-deck circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya know I'd be an ass not to pinch- hit for you here. You're 0 for 18  against Duke. Plus you're beat to  shit you can hardly walk, there's no  way you can get around on this guy's  fast ball. So I want the absolute  truth here. Can you beat this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor starts for the plate, as Duke finishes his warmups Brown comes down the dugout steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Pepper) Send Hayes the first pitch. I don't  want Taylor takin' too many strikes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pepper begins flashing signs out to Hayes. Duke gets up o the rubber and takes his stretch. Hayes leads away, crouc low. Duke snaps a throw over to first, the first baseman  slapping a hard tag on Hayes, but Hayes is back. The crowd is on its feet again. The "GO" chant starts,  punctuated by thousands of black-gloved hands punching th night air. Duke comes set again. Hayes leads away. Duke watches him, checks him again. We go to SLOW MOTION as Duke kicks and  comes to the plate. Hayes takes off like a shot, head down, eating up ground. Taylor swings and misses. The Yankee catcher comes up  throwing, rifling a clothesline dart to second base. Haye leaves his feet diving for the bag. The second baseman sn down the tag. Too late. Hayes is in there. The stadium is really rockin' now. Duke prowls the mound. Taylor steps out of the box and flashes a sign to Brown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashing some signals. That's a hell  of an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brown flashes a sign out to Hayes. A hint of a smile come over Hayes' face as he dusts himself off. Taylor steps back in as Duke gets up on the rubber. Taylo digs in his back foot, then points to the left field blea ala Babe Ruth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this? Taylor is pointing to  the bleachers, calling his shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd, electrified by Taylor's gesture, remains on it feet. Duke stares in at Taylor, comes to his stretch and  then lets go a steaming fast ball right at Taylor's head. Taylor goes down in a swirl of dust, the ball missing him inches. The stadium explodes with BOOS, but as soon as Ta picks himself up, the crowd begins to ROAR again. Bobby, Vic and Johnny are pounding out a heavy beat on th TOM-TOMS. Everyone in the stadium begins to CLAP in uniso with the DRUMS. Taylor steps back in and once again points to the bleache

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Taylor points again) Unbelievable. They're on their feet  here, stomping, clapping. C'mon,  join in wherever you are out there.  Let's hear you, Cleveland.

dialogues.speaker: THE LONGSHOREMEN
dialogues.text: and several of their friends at their bar, huddled around the RADIO with the punks and heavy metal kids we saw befo Slowly they begin to clap in time with the tom-toms which are audible on the T.V.

dialogues.speaker: THE BUSINESS EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: at the opera with his wife, a radio earplug in his ear. H hand taps on his leg in sync with the TOM-TOMS.

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO KOREAN GROUNDSKEEPERS
dialogues.text: (Sc 222 before scene 221) beating on their shovels in the bullpen.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE APARTMENT BUILDING
dialogues.text: FRAMED against the Cleveland skyline. In several of the l windows we see people banging things or clapping.

dialogues.speaker: THE STADIUM AGAIN
dialogues.text: Duke gets back on the hill. Getting the sign he wants, he comes to his stretch, checking Hayes at second. As Duke starts his delivery to the plate, we go to SLOW  MOTION. The clapping in the stadium stops as everyone hus to watch the pitch. We...

dialogues.speaker: AND THE APARTMENT DWELLERS
dialogues.text: They've all stopped too in anticipation of the pitch.

dialogues.speaker: THE STADIUM
dialogues.text: Everything from here on will continue to be in SLOW MOTIO As Duke whips his arm toward the plate, Hayes takes off f third. Taylor, instead of swinging away, shortens up on t bat and bunts Duke's pitch down the third base line. The Yankee third baseman, caught completely unaware, char the ball frantically.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: barreling down the line toward first on his sore legs, gi it everything he's got.

dialogues.speaker: THE THIRD BASEMAN
dialogues.text: scooping up the ball barehanded and firing on the run to  first.

dialogues.speaker: TAYLOR
dialogues.text: pounding down the line. He strains for the bag as the Yan first baseman stretches to his limit for the throw. Taylo and the ball arrive at almost the same time. Taylor hits bag and then sprawls in the dirt as his knees give out. The umpire brings up his arms, and spreads them wide. Saf Taylor's beaten it. The first baseman looks up to see something that strikes  fear into his heart across the field. It's...

dialogues.speaker: HAYES
dialogues.text: streaking for home, trying to score all the way from seco on a bunt. The first baseman fires to the plate, as the catcher posi himself for the throw. Hayes launches into a flying feet- first slide. The catcher brings the tag down. Hayes hooks the outside, his trailing foot reaching for the plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hayes is gonna try to score! Here  comes the throw. He slides. He is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hayes' foot catches the corner of the plate. The umpire p the palms down and whips them apart. It's all over, folks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Safe. The Indians win it. The  Indians win. Oh my God, the Indians  win it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pandemonium breaks loose in Municipal Stadium. Rachel hug Donovan, dances around, punches the air, then hugs Donova again. Everywhere people are hugging and kissing each oth Bobby, Vic and Johnny are going berserk in the bleachers. Thelma sits quietly, a tear rolling down her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of our other fans. We see... A) The Business Executive stand up and yell "Yes!" in the middle of the opera. Several other men stand up and expre their excitement as well. B) The Longshoremen whoop it up in their bar -- exchangin fives and hugs with the punkers and heavy metal kids. C) The various apartment dwellers dancing, clapping, yell out the windows. D) The two Korean Groundskeepers just shaking their heads amazement. E) Elsewhere in the stadium, the joyous exultation contin unabated. The crowd pours onto the field as Hayes runs to Taylor and literally leaps into his arms. F) The two spin around throwing their fists in the air. G) Cerrano and Harris embrace. Dorn gives Vaughn a hug, t steps back and decks him with a right hand. H) Dorn pulls Vaughn back to his feet, and they hug again I) Up in the stands, Rachel watches all this with tears i her eyes. Taylor starts off the field when he sees something that  catches his eye. Standing by the field rail is Lynn. She  holds up her left hand and smiles. There's no ring on it. Taylor races over to her as she jumps down from the rail hugs herself to him. We HOLD on the celebration as it swi all around them, and...
